trans-unit.source: Xenko 2.1 release notes
trans-unit.target: Xenko 2.1 release notes

trans-unit.source: 12 September 2017
trans-unit.target: 12 September 2017

trans-unit.source: Highlights
trans-unit.target: Highlights

trans-unit.source: Local reflections
trans-unit.target: Local reflections

trans-unit.source: Xenko 2.1 introduces local reflections. When you enable this post effect, the scene is reflected in glossy materials.
trans-unit.target: Xenko 2.1 introduces local reflections. When you enable this post effect, the scene is reflected in glossy materials.

trans-unit.source: Local reflections
trans-unit.target: Local reflections

trans-unit.source: You can enable and customize local reflections in the graphics compositor on the post effects properties.
trans-unit.target: You can enable and customize local reflections in the graphics compositor on the post effects properties.

trans-unit.source: Enable local reflections
trans-unit.target: Enable local reflections

trans-unit.source: For details, see Local reflections.
trans-unit.target: For details, see Local reflections.

trans-unit.source: Clear coat shading
trans-unit.target: Clear coat shading

trans-unit.source: Xenko 2.1 includes a clear-coat material template that uses physically-based rendering to simulate vehicle paint.
trans-unit.target: Xenko 2.1 includes a clear-coat material template that uses physically-based rendering to simulate vehicle paint.

trans-unit.source: Clear coat
trans-unit.target: Clear coat

trans-unit.source: Clear-coat shading has several advantages over creating the effect manually with material layers:
trans-unit.target: Clear-coat shading has several advantages over creating the effect manually with material layers:

trans-unit.source: layers are blended based on distance
trans-unit.target: layers are blended based on distance

trans-unit.source: increased performance
trans-unit.target: increased performance

trans-unit.source: improved visualization
trans-unit.target: improved visualization

trans-unit.source: You can add a predefined clear coat material from the Asset view under Add asset > Material.
trans-unit.target: You can add a predefined clear coat material from the Asset view under Add asset > Material.

trans-unit.source: Add clear coat
trans-unit.target: Add clear coat

trans-unit.source: For details, see Clear coat shading.
trans-unit.target: For details, see Clear coat shading.

trans-unit.source: Thin glass materials
trans-unit.target: Thin glass materials

trans-unit.source: You can now render thin glass materials such as windshields. The diffuse color controls the tint of the glass and how much light is blocked (darker colors block more light).
trans-unit.target: You can now render thin glass materials such as windshields. The diffuse color controls the tint of the glass and how much light is blocked (darker colors block more light).

trans-unit.source: Glass materials
trans-unit.target: Glass materials

trans-unit.source: You can add a predefined Glass material from the Asset view under Add asset > Material.
trans-unit.target: You can add a predefined Glass material from the Asset view under Add asset > Material.

trans-unit.source: Select thin glass material
trans-unit.target: Select thin glass material

trans-unit.source: Improved light shafts
trans-unit.target: Improved light shafts

trans-unit.source: You can now use light shafts with any kind of light that casts shadows (ie point lights, directional lights, or spot lights). You can also use them with multiple shadow cascades.
trans-unit.target: You can now use light shafts with any kind of light that casts shadows (ie point lights, directional lights, or spot lights). You can also use them with multiple shadow cascades.

trans-unit.source: Additionally, Game Studio now displays light shaft bounding volumes in the scene editor, so you can easily see the areas where light shafts are created. To show or hide navigation light shaft bounding volumes, in the scene editor toolbar, open the gizmo options menu and use the Light shaft bounding volumes checkbox.
trans-unit.target: Additionally, Game Studio now displays light shaft bounding volumes in the scene editor, so you can easily see the areas where light shafts are created. To show or hide navigation light shaft bounding volumes, in the scene editor toolbar, open the gizmo options menu and use the Light shaft bounding volumes checkbox.

trans-unit.source: Show light shaft bounding volumes
trans-unit.target: Show light shaft bounding volumes

trans-unit.source: The LightShaftComponent settings have been simplified and now have settings to control quality and performance.
trans-unit.target: The LightShaftComponent settings have been simplified and now have settings to control quality and performance.

trans-unit.source: For details, see Light shafts.
trans-unit.target: For details, see Light shafts.

trans-unit.source: Texture streaming
trans-unit.target: Texture streaming

trans-unit.source: Xenko now supports streaming for textures. This significantly decreases the time it takes to load a game or scene, uses less memory, and makes your game easier to scale.
trans-unit.target: Xenko now supports streaming for textures. This significantly decreases the time it takes to load a game or scene, uses less memory, and makes your game easier to scale.

trans-unit.source: Streaming is enabled for textures by default. You can find the option in the texture properties under Format.
trans-unit.target: Streaming is enabled for textures by default. You can find the option in the texture properties under Format.

trans-unit.source: Enable streaming
trans-unit.target: Enable streaming

trans-unit.source: You can also set the global Streaming settings in Game settings.
trans-unit.target: You can also set the global Streaming settings in Game settings.

trans-unit.source: Streaming settings
trans-unit.target: Streaming settings

trans-unit.source: For details, see Streaming.
trans-unit.target: For details, see Streaming.

trans-unit.source: Render masks
trans-unit.target: Render masks

trans-unit.source: You can now set which render groups a camera renders under Graphics Compositor > Entry points > Render masks. For example, you can have a model be visible to Camera A but invisible to Camera B.
trans-unit.target: You can now set which render groups a camera renders under Graphics Compositor > Entry points > Render masks. For example, you can have a model be visible to Camera A but invisible to Camera B.

trans-unit.source: Render mask
trans-unit.target: Render mask

trans-unit.source: For details, see Render groups and masks.
trans-unit.target: For details, see Render groups and masks.

trans-unit.source: Improved profiler
trans-unit.target: Improved profiler

trans-unit.source: The Game Profiler script now displays more information and is easier to use.
trans-unit.target: The Game Profiler script now displays more information and is easier to use.

trans-unit.source: Profiler at runtime
trans-unit.target: Profiler at runtime

trans-unit.source: You can now:
trans-unit.target: You can now:

trans-unit.source: profile GPU information
trans-unit.target: profile GPU information

trans-unit.source: switch between CPU, GPU, and FPS-only results with F1
trans-unit.target: switch between CPU, GPU, and FPS-only results with F1

trans-unit.source: sort the result pages by Name or Time with F2
trans-unit.target: sort the result pages by Name or Time with F2

trans-unit.source: change how frequently the profiler gets and displays new results with - / +
trans-unit.target: change how frequently the profiler gets and displays new results with - / +

trans-unit.source: jump to a results page with the number keys, or move forward and backwards with F3 and F4
trans-unit.target: jump to a results page with the number keys, or move forward and backwards with F3 and F4

trans-unit.source: set parameters in Game Studio:
trans-unit.target: set parameters in Game Studio:

trans-unit.source: Profiler properties
trans-unit.target: Profiler properties

trans-unit.source: For details, see Profiling.
trans-unit.target: For details, see Profiling.

trans-unit.source: Debug text
trans-unit.target: Debug text

trans-unit.source: You can now display debug text at runtime. For more information, see Debug text.
trans-unit.target: You can now display debug text at runtime. For more information, see Debug text.

trans-unit.source: Debug text
trans-unit.target: Debug text

trans-unit.source: Rewritten input system
trans-unit.target: Rewritten input system

trans-unit.source: The input system has been rewritten to track different input devices and allow for better extensibility.
trans-unit.target: The input system has been rewritten to track different input devices and allow for better extensibility.

trans-unit.source: Allows detection of added/removed devices through events on the InputManager
trans-unit.target: Allows detection of added/removed devices through events on the InputManager

trans-unit.source: New device interfaces such as IMouseDevice, IKeyboardDevice, IGameController
trans-unit.target: New device interfaces such as IMouseDevice, IKeyboardDevice, IGameController

trans-unit.source: High-level IGamePadDevice replaces the gamepad functionality, with support for XInput
trans-unit.target: High-level IGamePadDevice replaces the gamepad functionality, with support for XInput

trans-unit.source: Lower-level IGameControllerDevice allows access to numbered buttons/axes
trans-unit.target: Lower-level IGameControllerDevice allows access to numbered buttons/axes

trans-unit.source: Automatic detection of plugged-in/removed controllers
trans-unit.target: Automatic detection of plugged-in/removed controllers

trans-unit.source: Support for different keyboard layouts and IME for text input
trans-unit.target: Support for different keyboard layouts and IME for text input

trans-unit.source: Access to resolution and absolute coordinates for mouse/pointer devices
trans-unit.target: Access to resolution and absolute coordinates for mouse/pointer devices

trans-unit.source: KeyEvent now has a RepeatCount member, indicating how many times the key has been repeated while being held down
trans-unit.target: KeyEvent now has a RepeatCount member, indicating how many times the key has been repeated while being held down

trans-unit.source: For details, see Input.
trans-unit.target: For details, see Input.

trans-unit.source: Improved Direct3D 12 support
trans-unit.target: Improved Direct3D 12 support

trans-unit.source: To support graphics functionalities on every platform, we've implemented missing features for the DirectX 12 rendering backend:
trans-unit.target: To support graphics functionalities on every platform, we've implemented missing features for the DirectX 12 rendering backend:

trans-unit.source: compute and tessellation shaders
trans-unit.target: compute and tessellation shaders

trans-unit.source: unordered access views for textures and buffers
trans-unit.target: unordered access views for textures and buffers

trans-unit.source: structured buffers
trans-unit.target: structured buffers

trans-unit.source: For more details, see the Changelog below.
trans-unit.target: For more details, see the Changelog below.

trans-unit.source: Improved environment fresnel
trans-unit.target: Improved environment fresnel

trans-unit.source: Fresnel describes how light is reflected depending on the angle the material is viewed from. Typically, high angles are more reflective.
trans-unit.target: Fresnel describes how light is reflected depending on the angle the material is viewed from. Typically, high angles are more reflective.

trans-unit.source: Previously, Xenko used an imprecise polynomial approximation to compute the fresnel for environment lighting (such as cubemaps), resulting in a bigger-than-expected white outline. Xenko now defaults to a precomputed BRDF environment lookup texture that matches our default lighting equations (GGX Schlick). This produces much more accurate rendering.
trans-unit.target: Previously, Xenko used an imprecise polynomial approximation to compute the fresnel for environment lighting (such as cubemaps), resulting in a bigger-than-expected white outline. Xenko now defaults to a precomputed BRDF environment lookup texture that matches our default lighting equations (GGX Schlick). This produces much more accurate rendering.

trans-unit.source: Japanese documentation
trans-unit.target: Japanese documentation

trans-unit.source: The documentation is now available in Japanese. To switch languages, use the Language button in the top-right of the documentation site.
trans-unit.target: The documentation is now available in Japanese. To switch languages, use the Language button in the top-right of the documentation site.

trans-unit.source: Switch language
trans-unit.target: Switch language

trans-unit.source: Breaking changes
trans-unit.target: Breaking changes

trans-unit.source: Input system
trans-unit.target: Input system

trans-unit.source: Renamed PointerState to PointerEventType
trans-unit.target: Renamed PointerState to PointerEventType

trans-unit.source: Changed the members of PointerEventType:
trans-unit.target: Changed the members of PointerEventType:

trans-unit.source: Down has been renamed to Pressed
trans-unit.target: Down has been renamed to Pressed

trans-unit.source: Move has been renamed to Moved
trans-unit.target: Move has been renamed to Moved

trans-unit.source: Up has been renamed to Released
trans-unit.target: Up has been renamed to Released

trans-unit.source: Cancel has been renamed to Canceled
trans-unit.target: Cancel has been renamed to Canceled

trans-unit.source: Out has been removed; use Canceled instead
trans-unit.target: Out has been removed; use Canceled instead

trans-unit.source: Renamed InputManager.ActivatedGestures to InputManager.Gestures
trans-unit.target: Renamed InputManager.ActivatedGestures to InputManager.Gestures

trans-unit.source: Changed checking support for sensors using Sensor.IsSupported to InputManager.Sensor != null (where Sensor is the name of the sensor you're checking)
trans-unit.target: Changed checking support for sensors using Sensor.IsSupported to InputManager.Sensor != null (where Sensor is the name of the sensor you're checking)

trans-unit.source: The HasDown/Pressed/ReleasedMouseButtons() functions on the InputManager are now properties
trans-unit.target: The HasDown/Pressed/ReleasedMouseButtons() functions on the InputManager are now properties

trans-unit.source: Removed GetGamePad(); use IGamePadDevice.State to acquire a gamepad state
trans-unit.target: Removed GetGamePad(); use IGamePadDevice.State to acquire a gamepad state

trans-unit.source: To obtain a gamepad, use InputManager.GamePads, InputManager.GetGamePadByIndex(index) or use the InputManager.DeviceAdded/Removed events
trans-unit.target: To obtain a gamepad, use InputManager.GamePads, InputManager.GetGamePadByIndex(index) or use the InputManager.DeviceAdded/Removed events

trans-unit.source: Removed GamePadState.IsConnected; use the InputManager.DeviceAdded/Removed events or check the value returned by InputManager.GetGamePadByIndex(index) != null
trans-unit.target: Removed GamePadState.IsConnected; use the InputManager.DeviceAdded/Removed events or check the value returned by InputManager.GetGamePadByIndex(index) != null

trans-unit.source: Moved IsPadButtonDown/Pressed/Released() to the IGamePadDevice as IGamePadDevice.IsButtonDown/Pressed/Released()
trans-unit.target: Moved IsPadButtonDown/Pressed/Released() to the IGamePadDevice as IGamePadDevice.IsButtonDown/Pressed/Released()

trans-unit.source: Moved the SetGamePadVibration() function to the IGamePadDevice
trans-unit.target: Moved the SetGamePadVibration() function to the IGamePadDevice

trans-unit.source: Locking the mouse with InputManager.LockMousePosition() no longer automatically hides the cursor; use IGame.IsMouseVisible for this
trans-unit.target: Locking the mouse with InputManager.LockMousePosition() no longer automatically hides the cursor; use IGame.IsMouseVisible for this

trans-unit.source: Removed PointerEvent.PointerType; use PointerEvent.Device is IMouseDevice to check if the event came from a mouse
trans-unit.target: Removed PointerEvent.PointerType; use PointerEvent.Device is IMouseDevice to check if the event came from a mouse

trans-unit.source: Removed PointerEvent.IsPrimary
trans-unit.target: Removed PointerEvent.IsPrimary

trans-unit.source: Renamed PointerId on PointerEvent to Id
trans-unit.target: Renamed PointerId on PointerEvent to Id

trans-unit.source: Renamed State on PointerEvent to EventType and its type to PointerEventType
trans-unit.target: Renamed State on PointerEvent to EventType and its type to PointerEventType

trans-unit.source: Removed KeyEvent.Type; to check if this was a pressed or released event, use the boolean KeyEvent.IsDown
trans-unit.target: Removed KeyEvent.Type; to check if this was a pressed or released event, use the boolean KeyEvent.IsDown

trans-unit.source: MouseWheelDelta is now -1 or 1 per scroll unit instead of -120 or 120
trans-unit.target: MouseWheelDelta is now -1 or 1 per scroll unit instead of -120 or 120

trans-unit.source: Removed MultiTouchEnabled on the InputManager; multi-touch is always enabled
trans-unit.target: Removed MultiTouchEnabled on the InputManager; multi-touch is always enabled

trans-unit.source: Light shafts
trans-unit.target: Light shafts

trans-unit.source: Removed ExtinctionFactor and ExtinctionRatio to simplify the light shaft component
trans-unit.target: Removed ExtinctionFactor and ExtinctionRatio to simplify the light shaft component

trans-unit.source: Engine
trans-unit.target: Engine

trans-unit.source: Renamed DebugConsoleSystem to DebugTextSystem
trans-unit.target: Renamed DebugConsoleSystem to DebugTextSystem

trans-unit.source: Now default RenderStageSelector select all entity groups
trans-unit.target: Now default RenderStageSelector select all entity groups

trans-unit.source: Known issues
trans-unit.target: Known issues

trans-unit.source: On Linux, when switching the underlying graphics platform, rendering doesn't occur or fail. To fix the problem, delete the cache, local, and roaming folders on the Linux host and restart the game
trans-unit.target: On Linux, when switching the underlying graphics platform, rendering doesn't occur or fail. To fix the problem, delete the cache, local, and roaming folders on the Linux host and restart the game

trans-unit.source: On iOS, if Enable device-specific builds is on (set in the project properties), it's not possible to debug game code. To speed up development, manually select the architecture of your device from the Advanced tab
trans-unit.target: On iOS, if Enable device-specific builds is on (set in the project properties), it's not possible to debug game code. To speed up development, manually select the architecture of your device from the Advanced tab

trans-unit.source: Performance issues on mobile (being worked on)
trans-unit.target: Performance issues on mobile (being worked on)

trans-unit.source: Live scripting has been temporarily disabled
trans-unit.target: Live scripting has been temporarily disabled

trans-unit.source: Changelog
trans-unit.target: Changelog

trans-unit.source: Version 2.1.0.3 - 12 September 2017
trans-unit.target: Version 2.1.0.3 - 12 September 2017

trans-unit.source: Enhancements
trans-unit.target: Enhancements

trans-unit.source: General
trans-unit.target: General

trans-unit.source: Updated the list of third-party libraries and sorted by editor and runtime dependencies
trans-unit.target: Updated the list of third-party libraries and sorted by editor and runtime dependencies

trans-unit.source: Game Studio
trans-unit.target: Game Studio

trans-unit.source: Reviewed and rewritten editor text (menus, button labels, tooltips and so on)
trans-unit.target: Reviewed and rewritten editor text (menus, button labels, tooltips and so on)

trans-unit.source: Removed redundant dialog boxes
trans-unit.target: Removed redundant dialog boxes

trans-unit.source: Improved directional light gizmo visuals
trans-unit.target: Improved directional light gizmo visuals

trans-unit.source: Improved translation gizmo design. Translation planes now always face the camera
trans-unit.target: Improved translation gizmo design. Translation planes now always face the camera

trans-unit.source: Reduced graphical glitches and optimized navigation mesh overlay rendering
trans-unit.target: Reduced graphical glitches and optimized navigation mesh overlay rendering

trans-unit.source: Removed special character restriction on string keys for dictionaries
trans-unit.target: Removed special character restriction on string keys for dictionaries

trans-unit.source: Changed the default color of the clear frame for better prefab editing
trans-unit.target: Changed the default color of the clear frame for better prefab editing

trans-unit.source: Added a mark for the origin in the scene and prefab editor
trans-unit.target: Added a mark for the origin in the scene and prefab editor

trans-unit.source: Added wireframe bounding volume for light shafts
trans-unit.target: Added wireframe bounding volume for light shafts

trans-unit.source: Added a context menu entry in the asset view to copy an asset's URL
trans-unit.target: Added a context menu entry in the asset view to copy an asset's URL

trans-unit.source: Allowed mixed document orientation in the dock panel
trans-unit.target: Allowed mixed document orientation in the dock panel

trans-unit.source: Assets
trans-unit.target: Assets

trans-unit.source: Updated to latest version of DirectXTex
trans-unit.target: Updated to latest version of DirectXTex

trans-unit.source: Improved the computation of dependencies between assets leading to faster build and thumbnails generation
trans-unit.target: Improved the computation of dependencies between assets leading to faster build and thumbnails generation

trans-unit.source: Changed how root parts of hierarchical assets (prefab, scene, UI) are referenced and serialized (direct references instead of Guids)
trans-unit.target: Changed how root parts of hierarchical assets (prefab, scene, UI) are referenced and serialized (direct references instead of Guids)

trans-unit.source: Engine
trans-unit.target: Engine

trans-unit.target: Added render group mask on the SceneCameraRenderer to cull entities per camera

trans-unit.target: Improved the game profiler (reduced performance impact, improved UX & visual, etc)

trans-unit.target: Added a profiling key to the script component for user script profiling

trans-unit.target: Added streaming support for textures.

trans-unit.source: Added support for GPU queries.
trans-unit.target: Added support for GPU queries.

trans-unit.target: Graphics

trans-unit.source: FXAA Quality was crashing in many cases, because the value doesn't work with all numbers between 10 and 39. It's now exposed as two controls: a Dithering combobox and a Quality slider
trans-unit.target: FXAA Quality was crashing in many cases, because the value doesn't work with all numbers between 10 and 39. It's now exposed as two controls: a Dithering combobox and a Quality slider
